body_html: Either approach works. If we want to always THCTensor_free on the tensors then we need to call THCTensor_(retain) in the branches of the conditional where newContiguous isn't being called. I took the approach that I did (check if tensor is contiguous before calling newContiguous) to minimize the number of lines modified.
body_text: Either approach works. If we want to always THCTensor_free on the tensors then we need to call THCTensor_(retain) in the branches of the conditional where newContiguous isn't being called. I took the approach that I did (check if tensor is contiguous before calling newContiguous) to minimize the number of lines modified.
body: Either approach works. If we want to always `THCTensor_free` on the tensors then we need to call `THCTensor_(retain)` in the branches of the conditional where `newContiguous` isn't being called. I took the approach that I did (check if tensor is contiguous before calling newContiguous) to minimize the number of lines modified.
